result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Lee Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA samle,pay the surcharge; his voting rights are suspended and he may never psosess firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger Lee Hall in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Defendant Roger Lee Hall in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 150 days served.  Court ordered 18 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 18 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victims during the entire sentence. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Attorney Kiley Beth Zellner in court, defendant Roger Lee Hall not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 05/11/2015 in Branch 40.
State's Witnes List recieved and filed.

Defendant Roger Lee Hall in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Defendant Roger Lee Hall in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.    The defendant waived his right to a speedy trial for 1 week.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CF418, 14CM4162 and 14CF4422 joined for the purpose of trial.  State will hold the offer open until final pretrial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Lee Hall in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Defendant Roger Lee Hall in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case before the court to address joinder issue of 15CF418, 14CF4422, and 14CM4162 and address possible recusal issue on case 15CF418.  Discussion on the record regarding Court and Court staff being called as possible witnesses on case 15CF418.  For reasons placed on the record, the court recused itself. Per the Clerk of the Circuit Court, this case is reassigned to Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Branch 40. Jury Trial date in branch 23 VACATED. Case transfered to branch 40, Judge Dallet forthwith.

Attorney Kiley Beth Zellner in court, defendant Roger Lee Hall not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Final Pretrial. Discussion regarding joinder and severance. Arguments from both parties. For reasons placed on the record and by stipulation of the parties the court ordered Cases Roger Lee Hall 15CF418 & Paul M McNeil 15CF425 to be severed. Court further ordered cases 15CF418, 14CM4162, 14CF4422 to be joined for Jury Trial.  State advised court of possible motion for recusal as to case 15CF418. Pending outcome of a motion hearing to address this matter the court VACATED the joinder of 15CF418, 14CM4162 and 14CF4422. Case set for a Motion Hearing, defendant to be produced. Cases remain set for Jury Trial on 5/4/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Kiley Beth Zellner in court, defendant Roger Lee Hall not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests case set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Court granted, case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.

Defendant Roger Lee Hall in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Roger Lee Hall in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County District Attorney's Investigator Anna Linden. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Discussion regarding joinder of pending cases. Case set for Status to discuss issue of joinder. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kiley Zellner not in court, defendant Roger Lee Hall not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay for William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defense counsel recently appointed, unable to appear for today's hearing. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing within the 10 day time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ayesha M.; Sheheerah M. Shaylah S. and Co-Defendant Paul McNeil.

Defendant Roger Lee Hall in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Roger Lee Hall in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.   Defense moves to dismiss Count 3 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Count 3.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
